cluster_classes.class_description: Life stages and experiential states of the butterfly as an adult, from immediate post-emergence to mature, graceful flight.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: newly emerged adult butterflyâ€¦ moment of beauty and grace in flight

members.entity_description: An adult butterfly immediately after leaving the chrysalis, before its wings have fully expanded and hardened.
The perceived aesthetic state of an adult butterfly in flight, characterized as beautiful and graceful.

cluster_classes.class_description: Concepts describing the adult stage of butterflies and its temporal characteristics, including the winged, reproductive form and how long this stage lasts.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Adult butterflies as the final life stage and the duration of the adult stage.

members.entity_description: The fourth and final life stage of butterflies, when they are winged, sexually mature insects that feed (often on nectar), pollinate, and focus on mating and reproduction, typically living from a few days to a few weeks depending on species.
The duration of the adult stage of a butterfly's life, typically from a few days to a few weeks depending on species.

cluster_classes.class_description: Distinct developmental stages in the butterfly life cycle, from egg to larval caterpillar, treated as organismal life stages rather than specific anatomical parts.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: egg life stage and larval life stage (caterpillar) within the butterfly life cycle

members.entity_description: The initial life stage of a butterfly during which the organism exists as eggs laid on host plants before hatching into larvae (caterpillars), with eggs varying in size, shape, and color by species.
The larval life stage of butterflies, beginning when the egg hatches into a caterpillar and encompassing the primary feeding, rapid growth, and preparation for pupation.

splits.name: Newly emerged adult butterfly stage
splits.description: The specific early part of the adult butterfly life stage immediately after emergence from the chrysalis, before the wings have fully expanded and hardened.

splits.name: Butterfly aesthetic state in flight
splits.description: The perceived aesthetic or experiential state of an adult butterfly in flight, characterized as beautiful and graceful, independent of its biological life stage.

args.justification: ClsC_dc523bae mixes a concrete biological life stage (newly emerged adult) with a non-biological aesthetic/experiential state in flight, so it should be split into a life-stage class and an aesthetic-state class.

args.new_description: The adult, winged life stage of butterflies, including the newly emerged adult immediately post-eclosion as well as the general sexually mature, reproductive adult phase and its typical lifespan.
args.justification: ClsC_7706dd85 and the split class ClsC_dc523bae_AdultStage both describe the adult butterfly life stage (general adult form, lifespan, and immediate post-emergence period), so they form a single coherent adult-life-stage concept.

args.new_description: The adult, winged life stage of butterflies, from immediate post-emergence from the chrysalis through the sexually mature, reproductive period, including typical duration of the adult phase.
args.justification: The merged adult-stage class should be clearly labeled as a butterfly life stage and grouped under a broader 'Butterfly Life Cycle' Class_Group for consistency with other life-stage classes.

ClsC_9205413b already represents egg and larval stages of butterflies, so assigning it to the same 'Butterfly Life Cycle' Class_Group as the adult-stage class unifies all biological life stages within one lifecycle grouping.

args.new_description: The perceived aesthetic or experiential state of a butterfly in flight (e.g., beauty, grace), modeled as a phenomenological state rather than a biological life stage.
args.justification: The aesthetic perception of a butterfly in flight is not a life stage but a phenomenological state, so it should have its own clear label and be grouped separately from biological life-cycle classes.

executed_decisions.justification: ClsC_dc523bae mixes a concrete biological life stage (newly emerged adult) with a non-biological aesthetic/experiential state in flight, so it should be split into a life-stage class and an aesthetic-state class.

ClsC_7706dd85 and the split class ClsC_dc523bae_AdultStage both describe the adult butterfly life stage (general adult form, lifespan, and immediate post-emergence period), so they form a single coherent adult-life-stage concept.
